body:
Thanks for the report. At the moment the .debug_gdb_scripts is not emitted on Windows on purpose since it caused GDB to freeze during startup (at least on my machine). I'll give it another try when I find the time.
If somebody wants to try this locally, they just have to adapt `needs_gdb_debug_scripts_section` in  https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/src/librustc_trans/trans/debuginfo/gdb.rs. Any feedback on which setups (Windows version, GDB version, ...) it works or doesn't work is helpful.

I removed the windows restriction and rebuilt. GDB seems to understand that the .debug_gdb_scripts section is there now, but windows will no longer run it:

```
cries@cries-desktop MINGW64 ~
$ rustc -g main.rs

cries@cries-desktop MINGW64 ~
$ ./main.exe
bash: ./main.exe: cannot execute binary file: Exec format error
```

meta:

```
$ rustc --version --verbose
rustc 1.1.0-dev (dc630d01e 2015-05-09) (built 2015-05-11)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: dc630d01e3eae8ba05db98383119bc2ddbbb01c1
commit-date: 2015-05-09
build-date: 2015-05-11
host: x86_64-pc-windows-gnu
release: 1.1.0-dev
```

Here's my gdb info:

```
cries@cries-desktop MINGW64 ~
$ gdb --version
GNU gdb (GDB) 7.6.2
Copyright (C) 2013 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
License GPLv3+: GNU GPL version 3 or later <http://gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html>
This is free software: you are free to change and redistribute it.
There is NO WARRANTY, to the extent permitted by law.  Type "show copying"
and "show warranty" for details.
This GDB was configured as "x86_64-w64-mingw32".
For bug reporting instructions, please see:
<http://www.gnu.org/software/gdb/bugs/>.
```

Like I said, gdb understood the section was there but I was unable to run the executable to test any more.
Thanks for the info. I'm running into the same problem. It's kind of surprising that the section causes the executable to be corrupt.
Triage: I'm unaware of any changes here.
Triage: above bug doesn't seem like it will be fixed, not aware of any other changes.

Visited during wg-debugging triage. We're not aware of any changes currently but it is possible that updates to the GNU toolchain that we ship in the `*-windows-gnu` target may have added support or fixed an issue that would allow this to work. The first step here is probably to retest after changing [the target definition](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/cf0fa76f2711a26ff114f005af886479867724f7/compiler/rustc_target/src/spec/windows_gnu_base.rs#L97) to generate the section.
